intro: Gouania leptostachya var. tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin gouania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
